website_summaries.verdict: A thoughtfully engineered garden hand tool with a unique, effective design.
pros: Curved hook end is ideal for precision tasks in the garden
Can be easily used with right or left hand
Many dedicated fans rave about its effectiveness
cons: Some users have trouble digging up weeds without extensive roots

customer_reviews.title: A super weeding tool that actually removes dandelions and thistles including ...
customer_reviews.text: A super weeding tool that actually removes dandelions and thistles including the tap root with little effort. Also fantastic for light surface weeding, digging small holes for planting, and scraping soil loose from the bottom sides of tapered soles left by shovels when digging holes to plant larger bushes etc. Overall a very sturdy and useful multipurpose garden tool. I appreciate that as I don't want a 7-piece trowel/hoe/rake/fork/spade/whatever/whatever/whatever set of tools when one will do the same job.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Area 51

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly and Easily
customer_reviews.text: All of the positive reviews are 100% accurate on this weeder. It makes the removal of any type weed quick and easy. The cobra head goes right into the ground without any significant effort. I have had a real problem this spring and early summer with onion grass. I know that you have to dig all the way down to the bulb root which seems to be incredibly deep and firmly in the ground. I was amazed that with the Cobrahead I got to the bulb quickly and found so many more smaller bulbs just waiting to sprout.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: Should cost less than $10. Dollar store quality.
customer_reviews.text: This tool seems to be not durable. At first inspection I thought it’s made out of plastic! The working part looks more like graphite rather than steel. They said the blade is sharp... it is not at all! Perhaps they meant to say “pointy”... I didn’t even try this Cobrahead tool, it probably would break as soon as I start using it in our clay rocky soil. This tool is overpriced, should have cost less than $10, not $30! I suspect the quality went downhill. Waste of time, returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Another Invaluable Addition to Hand Tool Bucket
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool! I was a bit of a sceptic, but watched a video of this tool in action and decided to give it a try. The basic operation is to push the tip straight down and the pry up. I found it especially useful along curbing with weeds in the flower beds. The best technique for me has been to insert the tool as close to the plant to be removed as possible. If the cobrahead doesn't pry it out, it loosens the dirt enough to pull the weed most times.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Sue

customer_reviews.title: Tool for my deserted island!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to, wow=this is great gardening tool of the season. I have heavy clay in one bed plus tree roots. Don't ask. The cultivator not only ripped through the heavy clay soil, but chopped through the roots. If I had just one tool for the deserted island, this would be it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Browning-Towns

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype  -- this tool is USELESS
customer_reviews.text: This tool is unable to pierce the hard clay soul of Austin, Texas. I bought this to dig out deep weeds and baby grape leave vines (which were 1 ft tall) and this implement was useless in breaking through into the hard soil. Update: Its Dec 31, 2018 and it rained yesterday and the soil is moist and I just tried to pluck out tall weeds, including dandelions from my backyard with the root ball. This instrument just rips the upper portion of the weed out in a sloppy manner and doesn't get the root. I consider this tool a complete failure.
customer_reviews.author: happykat

customer_reviews.title: Cobra Head reverse curve is great!
customer_reviews.text: I modified my Cobra Head weeder to become the perfect Goat Head weed extractor. The angle of the head is perfect to move through rocks and soil that lets me position the new “V” right around the tap root. Then I lift the handle while pushing the head down and against the tap root. The lever action pulls the Goat Head weed out with the root still attached. Works best if the soil is damp. I love the original design - I also love to tinker with tools for special applications.
customer_reviews.author: Maxter

customer_reviews.title: Do you want to be a Honey Badger!?
customer_reviews.text: This tool is makes you feel like a honey badger. It is an excellent weeding tool. Slip in in the dirt behind the weed, lift/wiggle gently while pulling on the weed, and the weed slides out of the earth, roots and all. What they don't advertise well enough is what an excellent digging tool this is. This thing rips through all kinds of soil with ease. Hard clay, no problem, rocky soil - easy! It is ideal for digging up/around sprinkler heads. It rips up furrows for planting. They should call this thing the honey badger! Buy it, you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: sunshynjunky

customer_reviews.title: I’m beating a dead horse at this point...
customer_reviews.text: Everything worth saying has been said already. I little spendy but once you take the plunge and get one you’ll see why. Top quality. Feels like it will probably last forever. Even in Georgia’s Piedmont region with red clay soil that typically more closely resembles terra-cotta than any kind of actual “soil”. Easy to use and has a plethora of uses. I’d be careful using it to aerate in pots simply because you get more leverage than one might expect and the cobra head end does have an edge to it. You can very easily start ripping through roots before you feel it happening.
customer_reviews.author: Gaaaaaaaaaard

customer_reviews.title: weeds are no match for this beast
customer_reviews.text: I hate pulling weeds, and this thing makes me actually look forward to it! I was shocked how much better it was than a garden trowel or pulling by hand. Where I live we get these weeds that look like celery inside. They are tiny but can grow up to 5 feet or more high. When they're tiny, you can often scrape them out of the ground, single tap root and all. When they're bigger, a few whacks at the ground with the pointy end loosens the weed enough that it can pull right out. Will have one of these in my kit from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Here's a video review that shows how the Cobra Head tackles nasty weeds like Texas Bull Thistle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bibeault

customer_reviews.title: Essential tool
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 70 year old petite lady with a whole yard full of dandelions. This tool and I made short work of an otherwise intractable job. Love the way it pops out those stubborn weeds, root and all, better than anything else I've tried. I bought the long-handled model first, thinking I could eliminate bending over, but my aim is not so good from a distance and that tool was more difficult to place, so I ended up bending over more to clear the work area. It will probably be more useful when the dandelions are more sparse next year. For close and speedy clearing, this little tool is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley H Burkhart

customer_reviews.title: Best Weeder Around
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these and ordered this for a gift. She was very happy with it. I use this tool every time I work in my very large garden, It is invaluable to me which is ehy I have two. I misplaced the first one and ordered a second because I find it so useful in weeding.
customer_reviews.author: dixiegal

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: The CobraHead Weeder and Cultivator is fantastic! We just got it today and my husband has attacked our weeds with a vengeance! He loves it! We have had many garden tools over the years, and are sick of wasting money on tools that are only fair. This one is a winner, and worth the expense. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R Stahl

customer_reviews.title: If you could name one garden tool you cannot live without...
customer_reviews.text: This thing does it all: weeding, tilling, digging, you name it. If you are looking to cut down on garage and garden tool clutter, this will definitely fit in your keep-it pile. This absolutely cuts through clay, is wonderful for planting hordes of bulbs, lifting and transplanting difficult plants like cacti, and as an added bonus, looks like a ninja weapon. CobraHead here has excellent production quality like the legendary tools of old that previous generations insist could endure without a warranty to make them feel all fuzzy inside.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Kryda

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Dandelions
customer_reviews.text: I use this solely for dandelion removal. You hook it over the dandelion, stick it into the ground, and, because of the angle, you get under the dandelion's root, which you can then pull out root and all. Easy! It works in flower beds as well as in lawns. Weeding is a bit like golfing (says this non-golfer), in that you use specific tools for specific tasks. I tend to go through my garden looking for a specific weed. If my theme of the moment is dandelion removal, I go through my entire yard looking for them with this tool in hand. The next day, I look for different weeds with a different tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A tool for countless uses.
customer_reviews.text: A really nice specialty tool that I use at home to loosen buried rocks, dig up roots, hand cultivate, and hundred of other uses around the house. This tool is extremely well made, and is very strong. It will not bend when I unearth rocks with it. I consider it a must have tool now that I have learned its uses. It is worth any extra cost you might pay. I highly recommend this strong and versatile tool.
customer_reviews.author: wise buyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This works even better than I expected, I removed the weeds of my front yard in less than half of the time and effort I otherwise would have to spent. It removes the weeds all the way from the tip of their roots, so efficiently, so powerful, and so handy. It worths every penny I spent, best garden tool I ever bought from anywhere. If you are looking for something to remove weeds, do not hesitate, buy it today, you will not regret.
customer_reviews.author: White Water

customer_reviews.title: Best weeding tool, ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the original Cobra from a Master Gardener sale to use in my yard. My husband later planted a huge garden. Since we always needed it at the same time, I bought another. He has a bunch of other weeding tools but this is the one we always use for planting as well as weeding. It seemed pricey to me, but it is well worth it. My daughter bought one on my recommendation, but got the short one. I tried it but don't feel like it gives enough leverage. She's ok with it though.
customer_reviews.author: j montazari

customer_reviews.title: Most popular weeder of our house!
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical about this weeder because of the price and the look of its simplicity. I was pleasantly surprised by how useful it is. The weight is just right. The curve is perfect. The metal is really strong. I really enjoy weeding with this weed! (I am not kidding!) My 12 year old son, my 7 year old daughter and I are fighting over it when we go out in the backyard. That really surprised me!
customer_reviews.author: emi

customer_reviews.title: I Dig It!
customer_reviews.text: It looks weird but works great. This is a welcome addition to my weed fighting arsenal. I don't use poisonous weed killers in my organic flower and vegetable gardens so I use a small variety of weed extracting tools. The tool is quite sturdy, which is good because I have been known to bend or break my digging tools including large garden forks. I've found it is difficult these days to find long-lasting, sturdy tools. Warning-the tip is quite sharp and it comes with a silicone-like tip cover for storage. i don't know how long this cover will last but I will probably lose it anyway!
customer_reviews.author: cafejacque

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my gardening life?
customer_reviews.text: We were strolling through Bellingrath Gardens, outside Mobile, AL, and struck up a conversation with one of the gardeners on all things gardening. Just as we were leaving, she asked if we had a CobraHead. We told her we never heard of it and we have been gardening for a long time! She told us to get one and that it would make our work easier. The standard weeder hasn't been used since we got one. The mechanics of the CobraHead is so much more efficient than a weeder and as a cultivator. It's best tool there is for maintaining a garden.
customer_reviews.author: Don O'Shea

customer_reviews.title: works on Wire Grass - With Some Effort
customer_reviews.text: Used tool to remove wire grass in three raised beds. let the weed get too far along before I went after it so it took a lot of effort to get it out. Had to use the two handed pull like crazy technique but I got most of it out. don't think you ever eradicate wire grass. works on other less gnarly weeds with much less effort. Maybe cobra can put this tool on the end of a 4 foot pole.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent useful versatile sturdy easy to use tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most useful tools I own- it’s versatile with weeding and chopping and digging and so easy to use that it’s an extension of your hand. I also have the mini version that I use more because of its size and the work I need to do, but I certainly do appreciate having both of them in my gardening and perpetually weed fighting arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: AnneGG

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST/EASIEST TO USE WEEDING TOOL ANYWHERE
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for over 10 years and purchased this one for my daughter. IT IS THE BEST WEEDING TOOL OUT THERE. It is incredibly sturdy, you do not have to use a lot of muscle to get the weeds out. It attacks weeds with very deep roots and is easy to accurately get the weed and not your plant out. It is my most used gardening tool ever. If I ever lost it I would order another in a heart beat. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Wendydag

customer_reviews.title: Great construction, I like the handle grip as well
customer_reviews.text: I put this tool to work the day it arrived. Great construction, I like the handle grip as well. I imagine. This tool will get a great workout over the next several months. As weeder/cultivator tool, in hydrated, but not wet dirt, it helps loosen the soil around the root(s) for better chance, but not for all weed types, of removing the entire root, So far I'm happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Great Garden Hand Tool
customer_reviews.text: Finally. A garden hand tool that is not made of flimsy pressed steel that bends every time you put a load on it. This tool is expensive and worth every penny! Fits the hand well, pulls out deep roots of weeds and loosens hard packed soil easily. A great value and a tool I will be able to use for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought both CobraHead weeders long ago!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the long-handled version because weeding was becoming difficult; but found I can use this also, while sitting and weeding. The stroke is so much different from my others; no need to push forward with jarring force, but instead you weed pulling backward. It lifts weeds out really easily, too. Great for getting closeup to see the weeds hiding in the grass. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fran M

customer_reviews.title: Great. Could Not Wait To Use It!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Like the short handle better because I can use my other hand to move the scraped weed out of the way. I have the long handled one also that I use less frequently but it fine for folks that have hard time bending over to the ground. The blade which kinda sharp but not knife sharp just seems to glide just under ground level very smoothly. Makes me want to get out there and get those weeds.
customer_reviews.author: underdog2904

customer_reviews.title: A repeat purchase. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is our third one of these tools, because we use this item for so many tasks in the gardens that...ahem...we lose them. Very effective for light weeding and tilling. Pays for itself in the gloves you won't wear out as fast because you're using a tool instead of your hands.
customer_reviews.author: MonarchMom

customer_reviews.title: Makes weeding easy, even in hard packed ground
customer_reviews.text: This makes weeding surprisingly easy. Even plants with deep tap roots living in dry, rocky, well impacted ground come up with little effort. I was honestly surprised at how easy this tool made weeding, and my realtor, who was over when I first tried it out, was similarly impressed. He thought it could only be improved by adding a long handle, so weeding could be done standing up. I laughed and told him I'd ordered one of those, too.
customer_reviews.author: Capri

customer_reviews.title: half the effort and twice the speed - UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: Arrived this afternoon. First impression...solid, sturdy, nice handle. Looks to be indestructible. Within minutes I was out in the garden weeding with it. What they say is true...half the effort and twice the speed of any other tool. My new favorite. UPDATE: JUN 22, 2017 - Spent many hours rooting out weeds already this year. Amazing tool. Easy to follow those under ground runners and remove them. It will do Knap Weed fine, but Radius Garden Root Slayer Shovel is even better and faster for getting that root out. Very heavy duty cutter of all roots.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bissett

customer_reviews.title: CobraHead Original Weeder & Cultivator Garden Hand Tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this weeder. I have both the regular hand tool (not mini) and the long handle versions. I could not find my original hand tool which is why I had to purchase again. Otherwise, I do not think I would have ever had to buy a replacement. It is very sturdy and I cannot imagine gardening without it.
customer_reviews.author: Zinniagirl

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the birthday presents for my wife a couple of years back. She immediately fell in love with it. She is always in one of her gardens and this is never very far away. It is her GO TO tool! She says it the absolute best gardening tool she has ever used. So don't hesitate.....buy now! You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: C. Finney

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: It’s an amazing tool, super sturdy, and the most popular tool in the tool shed when I have volunteers working on my farm. It’s an equally requested Christmas / birthday gift. If and when my current bunch dies they will be immediately replaced, love this tool.
customer_reviews.author: M. Reslock

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well Even with the Red Clay Soil In Our Garden
customer_reviews.text: The soil in the vegetable garden can be very tough, and this tool is able to handle the pressure and pulling necessary to cut through and soften the soil as I weed or prepare soil for planting. I also enjoy using it for working fertilizer in the soil around the base of plants.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable easy to get your nasty weeds out
customer_reviews.text: This tool makes my gardening job much easier and faster. I used to get so frustrated when time lullout nasty weeds from my big garden. I am glad I brought it, even though it is pricey compared to others. I hope this tool last long. I want to buy another one for my other property, I hope the seller can give me a coupon for 2nd purchase discount.
customer_reviews.author: AngieReviews

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE THIS thing
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE THIS thing!!!!! I've got a few areas of very shallow tiny root systems growing just under the dirt surface, it plows through without too much effort for me . I'm 66 so with all the dry weather here and dirt like concrete, except when damp or wet. The Cobra is my " go to " and it is so handy
customer_reviews.author: DR Fontes

customer_reviews.title: Cobrahead Weeder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weeder for those stubborn weeds. I am not sure what the rating/review question means about "Stretch" because the item does not itself 'stretch' but it does allow for a deeper piercing into the soil so that you can get down deep and under the weed.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Cobra head
customer_reviews.text: I believe this tool is probably better suited to regions with rich loose soil. I have mobility issues and weakness in my hands so trying to dig in hard packed desert dirt with the cobra head cultivator/weeder just doesn't work for me. I do use it in flower pots so will be keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: AZMA

customer_reviews.title: A simple tool that works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Makes hand weeding go so much faster...just wack this puppy into the ground, and it hooks up the roots so you can pull out the weed at the root base. I have sumac ‘suckers’ that pop up continually and this simple tool makes pulling those suckers easier.
customer_reviews.author: luddite63

customer_reviews.title: Essential gardening tool!
customer_reviews.text: This tool has been really great for removing unwanted growth in my garden. I wish I had known about it sooner. Great for dandelions and pretty much anything else. It seems the results have lasted longer than previous years weeding the same areas by hand. This is definitely an essential garden tool.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky K.

customer_reviews.title: Makes weeding so easy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool! It has become my "go to" tool for weeding, planting, loosening the soil. I had read reviews on how easily it removes weeds including the roots, but honestly didn't expect it to work as well as it does. It makes weeding so easy, It is well made, the handle is comfortable and I think I will be buying another one just in case I lose this one.
customer_reviews.author: It's a zoo

customer_reviews.title: Best garden tool ever. Period.
customer_reviews.text: This fantastic device is the best tool yet for any kind of deep rooted weed, runner grass along the sides of the raised beds, and cultivating. Although I use it in multiple other ways as an extention of my hand. This is my second purchase. I lost mine somewhere in garden one evening, and had to use a different weeding tool the next day. As a result BOTH my wrists were so messed up! I'd used both hands on the thing trying to get the same result as the CobraHead. I had to wear a brace on one of them. This new one is going to have a streamer of fuscia plastic tape tied to the handle! Accept no substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Heath

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the garden
customer_reviews.text: Great product! This thing handles the biggest, toughest weeds around. It easily gets under/behind the full root and rips the whole thing out. Others have posted videos of it in action, I can tell you it works exactly as shown. I liked it so much I got my mom one for Mother's Day.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING! And worth every penny. It’s easy to use, light weight and sturdy! Makes it very easy to dig up weeds in my flower bed with ease. You can even dig nasty, thick, deep rooted weeds up without any problems. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kaley Brydon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: A versatile and sturdy garden tool that is super for tough weeds but also good for digging in small amounts of compost or soil amendments. Useful for prepping veg. garden for planting. Feels good in the hand, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool For Many Gardening Jobs
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a couple of months, and I’m very happy I purchased it. I use it for various gardening jobs including weeding, cultivating around plants, digging and planting. In particular I used it recently when I was double digging a few beds. When I hit rocky clay subsoil my spade and digging fork could not penetrate it at all. With this tool I was able to break up several inches of subsoil and remove rocks. It seems very durable and well made.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Great Weeder!
customer_reviews.text: This device is quite simply one of the best tools for weeding we’ve ever owned. We decided to try it because we have a stone walkway where the stones are separated by about 1/2 - 3/4”. This tool is perfect for keeping the weeds out!
customer_reviews.author: Scott P

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and works easily.
customer_reviews.text: What was I waiting on? This little cobra looks nice, but the weeds don't stand a chance. Took me about 20 minutes to fully weed a 2x10 bed of rambling weeds (See picture). Gets out the root and requires little follow up for return weeds. Works like a dream on precision weeding; I also use the CobraHead in my ornamental ground cover to get out the occasional nuisance without causing too much surrounding damage.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Scratch

customer_reviews.title: This tool is awesome. It is great for deep soil cultivation
customer_reviews.text: This and its long-handled version are my most used tool. This tool is awesome. It is great for deep soil cultivation. I use it to work three wildflower strips before planting season. I used to break up the soil with a tractor cultivator, but now I have stuff that is coming back every year, so I don't want to plow everything under. I can't say enough good things about this tool and the long-handled version.
customer_reviews.author: C. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it 4 stars because it doesn't have an opening on the tip and that makes more difficult to pull the weeds. Also is overpriced for I have a 3 dollars weeder and does a pretty decent job. This one is bent and that's helpful but again really overpriced and I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Rad
customer_reviews.text: Super rad tool. A great gift idea for a real Gardner not some poser who doesn’t grow their own vegetables or doesn’t mow they own grass. This is. REAL GARDNERS tool. Strong not cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the best weeder I've ever used, and I've used it a lot. Last summer I couldn't find it for awhile, and was about to order another because I don't ever want to garden without one again. Fortunately, I finally found where I'd misplaced it. It must be indestructable. Most other weeders I've tried have eventually suffered from lost handles, bent metal, or rust. This one is still as good as new. It's perfect for digging all types of weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Weazy

customer_reviews.title: Does very Well in our Garden
customer_reviews.text: The tool lets us quickly get rid of weeds in our garden. Pointed end lets you get down to the roots of the weeds and pry them up. I'm not sure it would do as well in hard clay.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Cobrahead I bought. My husband loved the first one I bought so much that he swiped it! Using this, I can control where I cultivate. The "head" is excellent at digging up soil and weeds; it's easy to control because of the cushioned handle. Seven of my friends, all Master Gardeners, have ordered these after using mine. Cashy but a high quality product. Worth the $; we've used our first one a great deal for three years and it is still in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher905

customer_reviews.title: Super versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift for my daughter in law. I have had one for several years. It is the best weeder like have ever used! When she showed an interest in gardening I ordered one for her. It arrived super quickly!
customer_reviews.author: christy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Plain old hoe does a much better job. I used it in the greenhouse as well as the garden. Hard to use and seemed to go around the weeds not through them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as effective as I hoped it would be
customer_reviews.text: It's fine but not as revolutionary in weed removal as I thought it was going to be given the positive reviews. The tip is pretty thin, so combatting monster weeds or those with substantial roots is not always an easy task. Cleaning after every use is really important and don't leave outside because it will rust.
customer_reviews.author: Seek Felicity

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome weeder as well as cultivator
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome weeder as well as cultivator. Very solid construction, should last a lifetime. Have used effectively for pulling all types of weeds, as well as digging planting holes for garden plants and flowers.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Second hand tool
customer_reviews.text: I have one purchased before and really like the hand tool. Easy to use and very good on weeds. I bought this as a gift for a friend and she has nothing but good things to say about it. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: DMc

customer_reviews.title: I hate this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Dumbest design ever for pulling dandelion weeds. There’s nothing to grip the weeds and the pointy tip just cuts or rips the root rather than pulling it out in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn B.

customer_reviews.title: The best tool!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is so great! It can be used for any gardening job. I loved it so much I've recommended it and given it to several people as gifts. It it a fantastic gift for any gardener you know! It is great for edging, digging rows for seeds. I love that it's easy on the wrists, the typical shovel usually leaves my wrists sore. This guy doesn't!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Storm

customer_reviews.title: gets out tough weeds
customer_reviews.text: Great design, comfortable to hold used by both me and my wife. Also makes handy hoe to break up soil. No hype in description. the real deal. Should know that I was professional gardener for decades.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schachter

customer_reviews.title: Bifurcated Cobra head?
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, using it a lot with good results. It goes deep underground. Only hope the manufacturer had a similar one with a "V" shape end. That would be a nice complement to this one, some of my weeds have a straight down root going deep. Yes, Cobra with a bifurcated tongue would be great!
customer_reviews.author: PONDI

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it 100 stars! This tool is so easy to use. Don’t over think it. Just dig it below the root and pull up. I have found weeding to be so relaxing because of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: sivi x

customer_reviews.title: Best Garden Tool I Own!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool I own and I use it constantly. This is actually my second one of these. The first one, I've owned for many years. It is great to get the roots of difficult weeds. I got this second Cobrahead because from time to time, I would misplace my first tool, and I wanted a backup. Also, I wanted one to lend to neighbors. Yes, it's that great. I'll never go back to using a trowel or fork again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nash

customer_reviews.title: No Blisters
customer_reviews.text: Best new garden tool... actually, one of my best garden tools, period. It has replaced two of my weeders, a garden fork, a small trowel, my bulb digger... in fact, it's an all-around useful tool to have in the garden. It digs out tough weeds readily, without digging up the roots of nearby plants and flowers. Sturdy, functional and comfortable to use: no blisters!
customer_reviews.author: adknative

customer_reviews.title: Good in tight places!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the tool a lot, but I will reshape the handle to fit my hand better. It works very well on weed removal, however the price is a bit exorbitant for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: willycone

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorites
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know what I ever did before I got this I have two, similar, but yet work differently. I always have one or the other with me in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: rmbrn

customer_reviews.title: Really nice tool, would be nice to have slightly longer reach
customer_reviews.text: We are using this to get in between bamboo stalks to remove the built up leaves in addition to the usual weeding. They have a really long handled version, which was overkill, but 6 more inches would have been perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Markus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: This awesome tool allowed me to take my garden back from some terribly invasive grasses and vines and overgrown paths from deferred maintenance on my part. Got right under the roots and yanked them out with little effort. Pulling toward ones self seemed to take less effort than the normal pushing done with a spade. Highly recommend. Paid for itself in the first day. I can now do tasks I was hiring someone to do - I am 67.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hagar

customer_reviews.title: Best weeding tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gardening tool for weeding. I have had one for years and recently loaned it to a friend to try out and she loved it so this purchase was a gift for her birthday
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. Due to all the rain the weeds in the garden have gotten ahead of me. I can get ahold of the grass or weed and give the roots a few whacks with this and they pop right out. Make that job of pulling weeds so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite garden tool. Great for getting close to new plants in the garden. I love both sizes, but the smaller one fits in my hand better.
customer_reviews.author: Greyhound

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is the tool I've been looking for to help with my gardens. Compact size but more than strong and durable enough for any job I've come up with so far. Helps get those deep roots up and out.
customer_reviews.author: Age Old Dinosaur

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and can be used with force.
customer_reviews.text: The tool is easy to use and sturdy. It is useful for weeds with small bulb like roots. Also, it is good for individual dandelions and crabgrass.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Bingham

customer_reviews.title: bought three new tools and this is the only one I have used
customer_reviews.text: bought three new tools and this is the only one I have used. easy and gets right to the roots of the weed. handle could be a little softer for comfort, but all in all, great product.
customer_reviews.author: leonbones

customer_reviews.title: No regrets on this purchase. great tool. Sturdy and functional.
customer_reviews.text: Of my many purchases on Amazon, this tool is the best investment. I do recommend and would buy it again but for a friend, since my tool will last forever! Yes buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mutiny of the Weeds THWARTED
customer_reviews.text: I panicked when my favorite yard tool was misplaced by one of my small "helpers", and so I ran right out to Amazon to buy two more! I've used my cobra for several years and have given a couple away as gifts. It is perfect for grabbing weeds...just a quick flick of the wrist down and then towards you. Don't want to live without this one...at least not in my Florida native landscape, where the grass is always threatening a takeover.
customer_reviews.author: Kritna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tool
customer_reviews.text: Cobrahead, where have you been all my life? This great tool makes the job of getting the weed up with the root intact so much easier. I received it today and went to town on my wild violets and oxalis. Im able to get the root of the violet out every time on the first pass. It disturbes the surrounding soil just enough to get the root out, not more - you're not left with a big hole. It is a hand tool so if you have arthritis you still have to watch your body mechanics and not overdo. But this is the best gardening tolol I've ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have gardening tool!!
customer_reviews.text: I own a gardening business, and I could not live without the Cobra. I use both the large and the small size daily. A great investment. I suggest putting some neon duck tape, or something very bright on the handle. They tend to blend in and get lost.
customer_reviews.author: John Persak

customer_reviews.title: These are great for getting to deeper roots on weeds and to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the CobraHead Weeder for my sister because I have had mine for many years. These are great for getting to deeper roots on weeds and to loosen the soil. If you go on vacation and need help with weeds or if it rains for several days and overgrowth takes over, this is the best tool out there. I
customer_reviews.author: IrisDaughter

customer_reviews.title: Makes weeding FAST & EASY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lost my old one when I moved. I was so glad to find this on Amazon! This tool makes quick work of weeding your garden!
customer_reviews.author: BarbNTexas

customer_reviews.title: My dad
customer_reviews.text: My favorite tool. It is amazing for deep rooted weeds, digging holes to plant, loosening soil... I have a community garden plot that is plagued by weeds and this is my first line of defense.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Made in USA, works great, ergonomic too.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Where head this tool been all my life? Extremely versatile. Great for getting weeds or in tight places around plants. Excellent trenching tool for installing sprinkler lines.
customer_reviews.author: Keeter

customer_reviews.title: Best garden tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this tool I thought the surface area for digging is so small that it will take forever to weed. Not so, this tool makes weeding in small places much easier and faster than any long-handled tool I own. I use it to dig out deep rooted weeds as well as turning it sideways to pull up the more shallow rooted grasses. It appears to be very sturdy and is easy to handle. I expect it to last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Bookwoman

customer_reviews.title: Best gardening tool out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gardening tool ever made! My friend has one and brought it over to help me. I use it everyday. It's amazing r
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: best weeder ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best weeder i have ever used. Everyone should have one of these. Used gently it get surface weeds, used deeply and it will get out the deepest weed. Only thing i use.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy tool
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a couple of days, but I like it. I bought it to dig out weeds between my patio tiles. Does the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tory

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as a gift to two friends I know love gardening and they really love the product.
customer_reviews.author: CambridgeMA

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have some rogue Liriope from the neighbors yard that has invaded my border. The only real way to get rid of it is to systematically dig it up. This tool is great at getting under the roots. Once I got it, I couldn't stop using it. Also good for digging a trench, redid the edge of my border in minutes. It will dig 3 inches deep without major effort. Really sturdy handle that can be used with one hand or two. Using it to dig up all the little saplings growing in the beds that have the strongest roots for a 3 inch plant. Happy Gardening!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: This thing does not work! I don't understand all the five-star ratings because this tool simply DOES NOT WORK.
customer_reviews.author: C. G

customer_reviews.title: Love it, should have bought a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: Makes easy work of pulling up weeds. Shovel is too big, can't pull with hands. But this little gadget makes quick work of weedy grass. It's not heavy but has enough force to yank out the weeds, roots and all It seems expensive but it is well worth the price,
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of a friend. It didn’t disappoint. I’ll recommend to anyone who does yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Yoyissima

customer_reviews.title: Not quite a strike!
customer_reviews.text: It is ok. Wish it was made a little narrower with a longer handle. For Seniors, it would be ergonomic to prevent bending and being narrow it would pull in the seams of the sidewalks.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Scott

customer_reviews.title: I Should Have Bought One of These Years Ago
customer_reviews.text: I've seen these in various gardening catalogs now for some time, and people always gushed about how great it is, but I couldn't justify spending $25 for something my hoe or my fingers could do. Oh man...was I wrong. This thing quickly becomes a natural extension of your body and it so sharp and effective at cutting into the dirt. After the first day of using it, I was like, "Man, I should have bought one of these years ago." It really is a great gardening tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rutablavsky

customer_reviews.title: Expedites Weeding
customer_reviews.text: They advertise it as 'a steel fingernail.' And it is. Really efficient way to dig out the weeds. I love working in the garden, but I have a couple big ones and weeding is a never-ending chore. But this really expedites the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Reader-in-Vermont

customer_reviews.title: The cobra head is my Allie in the fight
customer_reviews.text: So far this tool is fantastic. I have an on going battle with wild onions and garlic and this tool is great for bringing up the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my new purchases of gardening tools in the past year. Gets into narrow spots. Anything that makes life easier is much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sutter

product_meta.title: CobraHead Original Weeder & Cultivator Garden Hand Tool - Forged Steel Blade - Recycled Plastic Handle - Ergonomically Designed for Digging, Edging & Planting - Gardeners Love Our Most Versatile Tool
feature_bullets: BUILT BY GARDENERS - CobraHead tools are developed from seasons of hands-on gardening experience.
EASY TO USE - Our classic garden weeding tools are great for greenhorns or green thumbs of all ages.
TEMPERED STEEL BLADE - Gardeners love this tool because the curved head plows though any soil.
COMFORTABLE UNIVERSAL GRIP - Our recycled plastic handles are made for easy right or left-hand use.
MADE IN THE USA - All of our dependable garden tools are crafted with care in Cambridge, Wisconsin.
